Reviews.Title: “excellent location, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: M A Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: excellent location, authentic and spacious we enjoyed our stay there very close to train stations and a lot to see around. one thing you can do, is to have a longer walk from the hotel to Alexanderplaz to see the main cathedral, parliament, TV tower, etc

Reviews.Title: “Much better options within half a mile”
Reviews.Author: Tiborrr
Reviews.Content: Old hotel. Much more expensive than much more modern and nicer competitors in the vicinity. Most importantly, very poor service. Try to change something, like a reservation, you will be directed to your contract! Some German hoteliers need to take a lesson in customer service. It's my first tripadvisor review. Unfortunately not a very positive one, but that's what happens when expectations are unmet.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a short break, good location and value”
Reviews.Author: Hil_hants
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 4 nights at this hotel, over the New Year. It is in a quiet location yet is only a short walk to good bus/underground links, and for this reason alone is good value. The room was comfortable and had everything we would expect on a short city-break holiday. We arrived late to a warm welcome and overall the staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was average although they seem to pride themselves in providing something special. There was quite a good choice but, as mentioned in a previous review, some things, such as bacon, were not topped up if they ran out. I also have an aversion to coffee which has been kept hot for some considerable time. There are also some good places to eat within 100m (in the same road). I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are planning a trip to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, needs some renovation though...”
Reviews.Author: LBDelray
Reviews.Content: Great location within walking distance from downtown and the train station. Pros: friendly staff, WiFi worked well, good breakfast selection for the price. Cons: the whole building needs an urgent renovation, the room was small and lacking of light, carpet was old and worn out. I felt excessive usage of anti-odor spray after room service, which I personally did not like the smell. The headboard of my bed was falling apart. I've notified the service desk, they checked right away but decided to fix it after I check out. They did offer me another room but I didn't think was necessary. I haven't had any food at the restaurant so I can't speak for that. If I had to choose again I'd not stay there again, main because of the overall condition of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Meineke Arte Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sophie S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a beautiful old building located in the heart of Charlottenburg. Just off Kurfürstendamm ("K-Damm"), which runs through the centre of Berlin, this hotel is in a prime position and within walking distance of Tier Garten, Berlin Zoo and Kaiser Wilhem Church. The hotel itself is very peaceful as it is down a side street off of Ku-Damm. It is very close to the U-Bahn to get access to the outer areas of Berlin. The room we stayed in was clean and cosy, with a lovely large warm clean bathroom. We bought breakfast in the hotel on the first day, which was a substantial buffet but at 12 euros each. We did find that Berlin has numerous cafes, bakers, supermarkets and of course bratwurst stalls which offer a much better value meal. The staff were very polite and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, if rather Basic”
Reviews.Author: biffo1963
Reviews.Content: Superb location, just off the Ku'damm and an easy walk from Zoologisher Garten station even with a (wheeled !) suitcase. Make sure you walk right to the bottom of Meinekestrasse, the hotel sign is discreet and not visible from 100 yards like larger hotels. Meinekestrasse is full of restaurants so plenty of places to get fed at night - recommend Gasthaus Krombach if you can actually get a table ! Also a Lidl and a newagent/tobacconist in the same road for more basic requirements. Room was basic but clean and comfortable enough. As others have said there's no air-conditioning so I wouldn't recommend it during a spell of hot weather, but fine for nine months of the year. Checking out at 0630 ( 0925 flight from Schoenefeld) was no problem at all, Reception never sleeps ! My only slight quibble would be that people can enter from the street and go straight up to the bedrooms without passing or being observed by Reception - however the bedroom door had a mortice lock so we still felt secure at nights. Oh, and they don't have a safe for you to leave spare cash/passports in, although you can apparently use the Mark Hotel on the opposite side of the road if you need to do this.

Reviews.Title: “simple, very good location”
Reviews.Author: odika
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for five nights, it was very central, in a nice and quiet street, it took about 5 min walk to the bus or U-bahn stop. The room we got was simple yet all we needed, the only negative for us was not having a bath tub instead just the shower but that was fine. The breakfast times are rather good,so if you out later in the night, they finish serving at noon. It is a nice hotel but as mentioned before it would need a bit of TLC.The staff are very helpful at all times,its just a shame the 'old school' hotels like this are not preserved more and taken by the new 'ikea' ones. I'd recommend it though!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, fine for the price”
Reviews.Author: natalie c
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was in a great location, very close to the main shopping street (Ku'damm) and just a 5 minute walk to the nearest station. However, the room was rather hot and there was no air conditioning. Also, we were very unfortunate as construction work was going on at the time of our stay and it was extremely noisy. Luckily, we were out all day so it didn't bother us too much. Staff were very friendly and spoke good English. Decor in the rooms is very dated, however , being in such a fabulous location that wasn't a problem. Would stop there again, due to the central location.

Reviews.Title: “Simple accomodation in a good location”
Reviews.Author: travelBerlin
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this Hotel 9 nights with a friend. The price was reasonable for a city like Berlin and having lived in that city for many years, I knew it was going to be a good and safe location. Just about 100 mts to the nice avenue Kurfurstendamm, the hotel had a good access to plenty of restaurants and shops. Our rate did not include breakfast and we thought that almost 10 Euro per person was not really worthed. On the same street and about 30 mts from the hotel there is a discount supermarket called Lidl. We bought our water and fruits there. At the entrance from Lidl thee is a good small shop, with very nice coffee and pastries for breakfast for a good value. The room at the hotel was Ok and quiet. Unfortunately the room and other areas of the hotel did not look very clean. This is amazing in Berlin since Germans are most proud of their cleaning and sanitation habits. During the days we were there, we kept seing the same garbish at the floor in the etage leading to the elevator as if no one ever in the hotel felt responsible for cleaning or monitoring if every thing was properly done. I would probably come back to the hotel if I have to go back to Berlin for some days. It will be nice if management makes an effort to improve the impression that the hotel provides to guests removing the furniture which is broken and monitoring the job of the cleaning personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Silakka
Reviews.Content: The room was enormous and bathroom recently renovated. Everything was very clean and nice. Breakfast was OK as well. The only complaint was the internet connection, which was non-existent. Very good hotel for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Everything Old, Broken and a Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: dmi100
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel at all costs. Nothing was working and it wasn't seen as important. I went to take some water from the "free water and fruit table" and was treated like a thief by the gentleman on duty. It's not the 1940s - never again.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby but chic”
Reviews.Author: stumblebee
Reviews.Content: Our room (110) was rear facing and we did experience some noise from the kitchen below and the adjoining bar. The king-size bed was squeezed into an alcove leaving plenty of room on the left hand side but only about 8 inches on the right. Annoying if getting up to use the bathroom in the night, but otherwise not a problem. The bathroom is shabby but it is big and the water hot and plentiful. I point these things out, not to complain, just to paint a picture of what you should expect. But, I'm presuming that if you're considering this budget hotel (I paid £35pn through Expedia) then you're a money conscious traveller and won't be expecting huge fluffy white towels and porter service - which is good, because you won't find those here. What you will find is an excellent, albeit tired round the edges, hotel in a superb location with welcoming and helpful reception staff. Charlottenburg is a great place to base yourself. Within 10 mins walk of the Zoologischer Garten train station (the express train from Schonefeld Airport is every 30 minutes and costs €3) and 5 mins walk to Kurfurstendamm U-Bahn. There are a few goods bars and restaurants on the street - the place 2 doors down is exceptional - so you won't struggle finding food & drink within easy reach. I would definitely return to Berlin and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Grand City Hotel Berlin ( Meinekestrasse )”
Reviews.Author: business_travelller
Reviews.Content: good city hotel just one block of the boulevard Kurfürstendamm with large many different (and good) restaurants closeby walk to the theaters in Berlin-West ( Theater am Kurfürstendamm, Komödie am Kurfürstendamm, Theater des Westens ), public transportation nearby Hotel is located in an old typical Berlin residental building with heigh ceilings and ornaments (stuck), rooms facing the quiet garden court give you a good rest and make you forget the center city location

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BergenboyBergen
Reviews.Content: My room is a superior room, an I wpuld like to recommend this type of room to any other traveller. Nice space, in between10 - 12 feet from roof to ceiling, and probably more than 10 square metres. A nice and comfortable bed, a sofa, three chairs and a desk. And nice facilities. Really enjoyed ny stay so far (still som days left). The breakfast (I ate about 1030 today) was a bit of a dissapointment because they didn't bring fresh ham. Otherwise it seamed like a nice breakfast. Plenty of cheases and fres fruit, an av nice variety of cereal. Would recomment this hotel for anybody who wnts central living in west-Berlin. About a two-minutes walk to Ku'damm.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, truely a dump.”
Reviews.Author: thatoneguyinwa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great part of Berlin. Within in walking distance of several sights. Easy to get to. NO FREE INTERNET! They ream you for accessing the internet here. All my stops in Europe so far, internet access has been free. I was hugely disappointed in this. The carpets appear to have not seen the business end of a steam cleaner in God knows how long. Rooms are fairly spacious being it's just me. Again, carpets are pretty filthy. I had a bathroom in my room and surprise, surprise, it even had a flat panel TV. Staff could use a few classes in customer service, but not the worst I've encountered to date. I'm fairly certain that there are much better hotels in Berlin. Seek them out!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Muldeberg
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights to go to IFA fair. Booked 2 Comfort Single Rooms incl Breakfast. Got 2 HUGE rooms without explanation. Brand new bathroom. Room itself was with two chairs and a sleeping sofa. Very nice location, with easy walk to KuDamm and the new Hard Rock Cafe up the street. Breakfast was standard Buffet style with a few hot items, nothing fancy but OK.

Reviews.Title: “An authentic feeling hotel with a relaxing atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: froggyfran
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in June 2010. We took a comfort room for an extra £12 per night, which was worthy as the room was very comfortable (with a MASSIVE bed!) and the bathroom was spacious. The location was amazing, on a quiet street just next to the Ku'damm and the U-Bahn Uhlandstrasse (U1). The reception is open 24/7 and the staff very friendly and helpful. Also, smoking rooms are available! All in all, it was pleasant for a first stay in Berlin. Would recommend to anyone that enjoys a simple and unpretentious hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dunveganArgyll
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights. Selected a "business" class room. Very clean,comfortable,with an excellent bathroom. I believe basic rooms have not been upgraded and from photos on this web site are not a patch on the room we stayed in.Worth paying that little bit extra! Stayed on a room only basis. Tea coffee in the room and free use of the business lounge with tea coffe and free wi fi. Reception staff very nice and extremely helpful. Imbiss cafe at end of the street serves good continental breakfast. Opens at 9am. This hotel is really well placed for transport to all parts of the city. An ideal location,in a quiet street off the main shopping area. Good bars and restaurants all around at reasonable prices. The bar prices in the hotel are a bit steep so just pop across the road instead for a reasonably priced beer! We would definitely choose to go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, safe location and longest breakfast ever served from 6 to 12 !!!”
Reviews.Author: Pete&Karen
Reviews.Content: Don't get excited about the Mark Hotel as you will probably be looking as you arrive at their sister hotel across the road from the Mark! It's not as flashy as the more modern one but the sign is in italics and seems to say "Clark"!! After entering and accending the great old stairway you will hopefully find pleasant efficient local staff and good sized room as we did. Decor is in need of a refurb but everything functions and the beds were big comfy and very clean eqyptian linen. Price was great and location is ideal for shops and starts of bus tours on main street. Hard Rock Cafe is yards away and they dont site those is run down areas do they? Good value for money and legendary breaky times!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location but a Dump”
Reviews.Author: WeltreisenderNyc
Reviews.Content: You can't find a better location right next to the Ku-damm; you can walk to most restaurants, shops, and right next to the U-Bahn for further points in the city. The hotel needs updating. The furniture is worn. The bathrooms are in utter need of modernization and repair. The room was quite because it faced the back. The breakfast is very good but check if it's included in the price of your room, otherwise it's 20 Euro per person! They think it's reasonable because the sister hotel across the street is even more. You'll get a better value your money on any of the restaurant open for breakfast down the same street.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly placed, nice rooms,quiet area and a good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jørgen K
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 23.August -26.august. 10 minutes walk from Zoo S-bahn, quiet street and room toward the backarea - large room, nice beds and bathroom. The breakfast was very good and served from 6-12/great !!!! Nice staff and helpful if we needed any help. We definetely go back !!! Jorgen and Maria K - Norway

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: MairGravatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in this hotel. As others have said the location is superb even if the hotel is slightly run down. Beds certainly did creak as did the floor boards! Bathroom very clean and bedding crisp and clean. Our room overlooked an enclosed inner courtyard and was very noisy. The room did not have airconditioning and even with the windows (very small) open it was still stuffy and there was a constant dreadful stale smell of cooking from the kitchen. Therefore a great location for the excellent transport system and for good bars and restaurants, but I would not recommend this hotel for a relaxing rest after a long day's sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room, a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: swiftparty
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the tripadvisor reviews, as always, and wasn't disappointed! We had a large room overlooking a quiet courtyard. It was spacious, quiet and cleaned very well. Staff in the hotel were efficient, friendly and helpful. The breakfast was included in the very reasonable price and was just what we needed for a day's sightseeing. The location was fantastic. It is a very safe area, on a quiet street, yet close to many bars and restaurants which we used rather than travelling far afield in the evening. The hotel in near the ubahn and sbahn so getting about was no issue. All in all, I would recommend it and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a renovation”
Reviews.Author: Fael
Reviews.Content: The Meineke is very conveniently situated just off the Ku'damm in the former West Berlin. I emailed the hotel a week before our stay about some confusion over the room rate, but never got a response. One receptionist was very pleasant and the other was brisk but not unfriendly. As for the hotel itself, the entrance hall was very impressive, and it all went downhill from there. The beautiful period lift was out of order, the carperting frayed as you approached the reception, and the wood on the counter chipped. We then had to walk through a dark corridor with frayed carpets and a general air of decay into a rather rickety (modern) lift which took us to our room on the 4th floor. Another corridor of similar ilk later, we found ourselves standing in a run-down room with a window about 5 inches wide, with furniture that had seem far better times. The bed linen was spotlessly crisp and the double bed was a little bit hard, and the frame incredibly creaky - you would not be able to turn over without setting the whole frame off. Note that the double-beds have separate duvets, although we prefer this to a single duvet. The bathroom looked like nothing had been done to it since the early 60s, although it was relatively clean. Breakfast was uninspiring but included in the rate. So, the price is good if you are going to spend minimal time in the hotel in West Berlin, but would not recommend it for anybody who wants a place to relax in after a long day sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: BrianJonestown
Reviews.Content: The Meineke Hotel is clean and efficient and the buffet breakfast was more than adequate, if a little uninspiring. Being close to the Ku-dam (100 yds) meant plenty of bars, cafes and shops were on the doorstep. Also the Zoo terminal, i.e. the S- and U-bahn and the Number '100 bus' was just over 5 minutes walk away. From there Berlin opens up. The Hotel itself was quiet and the staff and guests (almost all German) were very approachable and friendly. Our tips if you are staying here: Try the Hamlet Restaurant on the Uhlandstrasse and the Hard Rock Café right across the road from the Hotel. The former for exceptional dining at around £13 for a main course. The lamb and duck were first class. The H.R.C. for a great burger accompanied by music and terrific service for about the same price. If you ask for a beer you'll be served a Berliner (lager). Most bars have quite a few to choose from so check out the menu first. Also, there were no disappointing Rieslings on any of the wine lists we tried. Wear your most comfortable walking shoes and be prepared to walk as it’s the best way to explore. We were there for 5 days but wished we had stretched it to a week. Places to visit are too numerous to list but the memorial under the remnants of the Wall and the Memorial to the murdered Jews of Europe (or the Haulocost Museum as some referred to it) are essential. Also go on the 'Famous Walk' on your first full day – I'd recommend Insider Tours at 12 Euros. It's the best 12 euros you'll spend. Andrew (the Aussie PhD student) was amazing and kept us hanging on his every word for 4 hrs +. A great city and a Hotel in a great location, which I'd definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Josephien
Reviews.Content: I come back from 6 days in Berlin where I stayed at this excellent hotel, I had read mostly positive reviews about it and some negatives, well, personnally I have only good feedback to give. My main satisfaction is the quiet nights and good sleep I had there, something which is extremely rare to experience in an hotel of whatever quality. The hotel is in an old-fashioned building, very 'berlinesque', very pleasant, very clean, the breakfast is a little expensive but in great abundance (eat as much as you want buffet ) the staff is very nice, the room was very comfortable, the bed excellent, I could not think of single bad thing to say about the whole place. I will definitely book there when I'll go back to Berlin. Josephien

Reviews.Title: “Cheap lodging uptown”
Reviews.Author: bfhogberg
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, friendly staff. No WLAN, unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Change of Name, but Same Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eburgh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is now known as the Mark Hotel Meineke. Don't confuse it with the larger Mark Hotel opposite. I would agree with the general tone of previous comments. The hotel has some very nice original architectural features, but it needs rennovation. Its location is convenient and quiet.With a very low rate from Expedia it was reasonable value, but in general it is flattered by its 3* rating.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Meineke Arte Hotel”
Reviews.Author: theRabit
Reviews.Content: Beautiful old building. Steps from main shopping on the Ku'dam & subway. The room was huge. Don't fall out of the garage-sized window. Bed very comf. The washroom was massive. Breakfast was great - I need their recipe for the breakfast sausage/meatballs. Picturesque wrought iron elevator wasn't working while we were there - lots of stairs, though I think there was another elevator at the rear of the building. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good value at 35 euros per night”
Reviews.Author: happy2travell
Reviews.Content: Great location, around corner from Zoo station.Nice and quiet. I was on business so booked as a single. Room was old but had a charm with tall ceilings along with long windows. Needless to say in true German fasssion everything was spotless. Forget the breakfast as the coffeee was cold and hot food terrible even though I was down early at 7-00. Try eating at the arcade across the road where you see the Lidl sign. Stay if you get at good price.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster”
Reviews.Author: iannitch
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 rooms this hotel in July 2006. Six of us were travelling to Berlin from Edinburgh for New Year. We were arriving on the 29th Dec and departing 1st Jan. About 4 weeks ago I reconfirmed our booking with the Hotel by telephone and asked about transport from Tegel Airport to the hotel. When we arrived on the 29th we were told the hotel had been over booked and was full. We were to be move to an "apart hotel" about 2kms away, part of a global chain, where three rooms had been booked for us. The manager of the hotel had already left for the day (6pm). She was eventually contacted by telephone, but with rooms at a premium over the holiday we had little option but to accept this forced alternative. I learned that the apart hotel had only been booked 4 days previously. Our rooms were obviously sold on to a higher bidder! Do not use this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: thomasgreve
Reviews.Content: Very central location, friendly staff, clean, good breakfast and big high ceiling rooms. However must say that the hotel look tired and needs a refurb. Theres no AC and the summer months gets hot in Berlin. Are you staying a few days and not spending long in the room then i recommed this inexpensive hotel. Not suited for special occasions as it doesnt give an immediate great first impression when you walk in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, stuffy room”
Reviews.Author: hiking_girl_78
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the Meineke Arte Hotel, during a very hot and humid spell in Berlin. Excellent location a block from the Ku'damm and close to restaurants in Savignyplatz (10 min walk), but it was quite quiet even though it faced a few other hotels and the Hard Rock Cafe. Staff was friendly, there was a fruit bowl up front for the taking, along with a small hotel bar. A few nice touches in terms of art (hence the Arte Hotel...). Our room was decent, nothing special, but the closet was falling apart and there wasn't any ventilation, so it got even more stuffy after taking a shower. Worth booking for the convenient location and if you get a good deal online.

HotelInfo.Name: Grand City Hotel Berlin Zentrum
HotelInfo.Address: Meinekestrasse 10, 10719 Berlin, Germany (Formerly "Meineke Arte Hotel")
